subtask.title: Develop Theoretical Guidelines
subtask.objective: Create a framework for deciding when to use AI agents versus sequential prompts based on task characteristics.
subtask.scope: Formulate criteria such as task complexity, environmental dynamics, and required autonomy.

verification.completion_summary: The research identified key distinctions between AI agents and sequential prompts, along with task characteristics like complexity and adaptability. However, a structured framework for decision-making based on these criteria was not explicitly developed.

covered_aspects: Defined AI agents and sequential prompts
Identified task characteristics (complexity, adaptability, real-time needs)
Contrasted use cases for dynamic vs. structured environments
missing_aspects: Quantitative or qualitative criteria for trade-offs

missing_requirements: A concrete decision framework with actionable criteria
Comparative analysis of AI agents vs. sequential prompts across all task characteristics
Validation or case studies demonstrating application
